sen.j: 金剛謹之助（こんごう きんのすけ、1854年（嘉永7年）- 1923年（大正12年））は、シテ方金剛流能楽師。
sen.e: Kinnosuke KONGO (1854 to 1923) was a Noh actor of the shite-kata Kongo school (one of the five schools of shite-kata [main roles]).
Kinnosuke KONGO (1854 to 1923) was a Noh actor of the shite-kata Kongo school (one of the five schools of shite-kata [main roles]).
Kinnosuke KONGO (1854 to 1923) was a Noh actor of the shite-kata Kongo school (one of the five schools of shite-kata [main roles]).

sen.j: 金剛流の弟子家である、京都・野村金剛家に生まれる。
sen.e: Born in the Nomura Kongo family in Kyoto, a disciple family in the Kongo school.
Born in the Nomura Kongo family in Kyoto, a disciple family in the Kongo school.
Born in the Nomura Kongo family in Kyoto, a disciple family in the Kongo school.

sen.j: 西の名人として名高く、関西を中心に活躍。
sen.e: Well known as a master in the west, he actively performed mainly in the Kansai region.
Renown as a master in the west, he actively performed mainly in the Kansai region.
sen.cmt: Well knownよりもRenownのほうが「名高い」(名が知れ渡っているだけではない)意味が伝わると思われます。
sen.e: Renown as a master in the west, he actively performed mainly in the Kansai region.

sen.j: 東の宝生九郎知栄と並び称される。
sen.e: He was admired together with HOSHO Kuro Tomoharu in the east.
He was admired together with HOSHO Kuro Tomoharu in the east.
He was admired together with HOSHO Kuro Tomoharu in the east.
One of the great masters in the Meiji period.
One of the great masters in the Meiji period.
One of the great masters in the Meiji period.

sen.j: 子に二十四世金剛流宗家・金剛巌 (初世)。
sen.e: Iwao KONGO (the first), the 24th head of the leading family in the Kongo school, is his child.
Iwao KONGO (the first), the 24th head of the leading family in the Kongo school, is his child.
Iwao KONGO (the first), the 24th head of the leading family in the Kongo school, is his child.
